Message.Title: Obama DOJ loses in fed court over Black Panther case
Message.Msg: A federal court in Washington, DC, held last week that political appointees appointed by President Obama did interfere with the Department of Justice’s prosecution of the New Black Panther Party. The ruling came as part of a motion by the conservative legal watch dog group Judicial Watch, who had sued the DOJ in federal court to enforce a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for documents pertaining to the New Black Panthers case. Judicial Watch had secured many previously unavailable documents through their suit against DOJ and were now suing for attorneys’ fees. The Obama DOJ dropped charges in the case involving armed Black Panthers who blocked Caucasian voters from entering polling places in Philadelphia during the 2008 Presidential Election. http://washingtonexaminer.com/federal-court-finds-obama-appointees-interfered-with-new-black-panther-prosecution/article/2503500 Where is the mainstream media's coverage on this? Also conveniently ignored by Yahoo "news".

Topic.Title: Coke a Total Trash Product ? Rot Your Teeth idiots

Message.Msg: KO has some great products ... Honest Tea ....Simply Orange & Simply Grapefruit. Not a big fan of Vitamin water but the kids love it. KO sells water too. I hear they are going into dairy products too.

Check the KO web site. Dividend for October and December will be 25.5 cents per share. The current dividend is .51 cents per share. Divide .51 x 2 = 25.5. Been down this road before. Stock prices usually increase after a split. Splits indicate company strength.
Sorry, I didn't notice the article, only 750 pics of almost-nude celebrities. How much money in libel lawsuits has that tabloid had to pay over the years?

Message.Title: What happens if I buy KO after the record date for the split?
Message.Msg: According to the Coca Cola website: •The record date, which is July 27, 2012, determines which shareowners are entitled to receive one additional share for each share owned as of the record date due to the split. July 27, 2012 is also the effective date of the amendment to the certificate of incorporation that will double the number of shares of authorized common stock. •The payment date (or distribution date), which is August 10, 2012, is the date shareowners of record are mailed notification of the shares received as a result of the split. •The ex-split date, which is August 13, 2012, is the date the common stock will trade on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "KO" at the new split-adjusted price. so If I buy after the 27th and before august 13 will I not get split shares?

Message.Title: Nice run and break out
Message.Msg: As I was figuring, the run in recent weeks hit that break out level, so with a little rest and small dip pullback, this great solid company could work up to $83 and keep looking good for the rest of the year. Going with momentum is usually a good bet.

Topic.Title: What happens if I buy KO after the record date for the split?

Message.Msg: "If I buy after the 27th and before august 13 will I not get split shares?" If you hold until the ex-date of August 13th, you will get the split shares. Anyone who sells before August 13th, no matter if they were a shareholder of record or not, will also be selling their right to the split shares.
